results.title: Julius Caesar
results.brief_description: Film adaptation of Shakespeare’s “Julius Caesar” stars Charlton Heston in the role of Mark Antony and Harold Tasker as Julius Caesar. Cast includes Grosvenor Glenn, Robert Holt, Mary Sefton Darr. Video also contains a collector’s bonus in the form of a 10 minute minidoco on the making of “The Ten Commandments” presented by Cecil B. De Mille.

results.title: Julius Caesar
results.creator_credit: John Phillips, John Copley, Channel Four, English National Opera and RM Arts
results.brief_description: Studio production recorded at Limehouse Studios, Docklands, London, of George Frideric Handel’s tale of love and power in three acts, “Julius Caesar”, with libretto by Nicola Haym in the edition by Noel Davies and Sir Charles Mackerras, English translation by Brian Trowell, performed by the English National Opera. Features Dame Janet Baker (Julius Caesar), Valerie Masterson (Cleopatra), Sarah Walker (Cornelia), Della Jones, (Sextus), James Bowman (Ptolemy) and John Tomlinson (Achillas) supported by the Orchestra and Chorus of the English National Opera conducted by Sir Charles Mackerras, Orchestra leader Russell Gilbert and Chorus master Victor Morris. This lavish production was specially made to coincide with Handel’s tercentenary in 1985. Booklet included.

results.title: Juliet of the spirits = Giulietta degli spiriti
results.creator_credit: Federico Fellini, Clemente Fracassi, Francoriz Production and Rizzoli Film
results.brief_description: A kaleidoscope of fantasy about a bored middle-class woman (Giuletta Masina) who discovers she can conjure up spirits each representing a repressed desire or restrained impulse in her nature. The spirits, apparitions in various guises, provide Fellini with the perfect opportunity to exercise his strong sense of the fantastic and the bizarre.

results.title: Julien Donkey-boy
results.creator_credit: Harmony Korine, Cary Woods, Robin O'hara, Scott Macaulay and Independent Pictures
results.brief_description: The first American entry to Dogma 95 is the second feature for Harmony Korine who faithfully embraces the manifesto by improvising scenes, shooting digitally, only using available light and minimal post-sound. “Julien Donkey-boy” also utilizes the loose narrative (or non-narrative) structure of his controversial feature debut “Gummo” (1997), offering a series of randomly connected vignettes in the life of an ‘average’ American family. Ewen Bremner plays the title character, a child-like schizophrenic whom we first see as he murders a young boy, then promptly goes home and forgets about it. Korine serves up an uncomfortable portrait of family life for Julien: a dictatorial father who is prone to wearing a gas mask (played with glee by director Werner Herzog), his sister, Pearl (Chloe Sevigny), who is pregnant with Julien’s baby and a young wrestling obsessed brother (Evan Neumann) whose father pays him to dress up in his dead mother’s clothes. The films loose style and roving camera makes it feel uncomfortably documentary like at times, while the films grainy, ‘no-frills’ look produces some surprisingly haunting and beautiful images. Cast also includes Joyce Korine and Chrissy Kobylak.

results.title: Cyberthon Archives [documentation]
results.brief_description: Cyberthon was a series of TV broadcast events initiated in the 1990’s in Melbourne, Australia. This collection contains photographs, images and documentation that accompany the moving content in the archive.
results.description: Cyberthon was a series of TV broadcast events initiated in the 1990’s in Melbourne, Australia. This collection contains photographs, images and documentation that accompany the moving content in the archive.

results.title: My best friend's wedding (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: P.J. Hogan, Ronald Bass, Jerry Zucker and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Julia Roberts stars in this hilarious tale of lovelorn food critic Julianne, who discovers she wants to spend the rest of her life with her best friend the day he pops the question to someone else. She has four days to break up the wedding and help her best friend discover that she’s the one. With an outstanding supporting cast including Cameron Diaz and Rupert Everett, this film takes the cake as the romantic comedy of the year.

results.title: My bed, your bed
results.brief_description: In an isolated community, a man and woman are promised under the traditional laws of marriage. The time has come for Delia and Alvin to move in together. Things don’t turn out as smoothly as they might. My Bed, Your Bed explores notions of Aboriginal identity through an examination of the ways that Aboriginal people living in Central Australian bush communities adopt values from both contemporary and traditional works.

results.title: Cyberpunk
results.creator_credit: Marianne Trench, Peter Von Brandenburg and Intercon Productions
results.brief_description: The term ‘Cyberpunk’ was first used to describe a new genre of science fiction literature, inaugurated by the publication of William Gibson’s book ‘Neuromancer’. A self confessed computer illiterate, Gibson’s visions began shaping the way people thought and spoke about future technologies. This program examines the concepts central to the Cyberpunk movement and interviews Cyberpunks, young people determined to use technology against those who would otherwise control that technology. The program covers computer animation, hacking and piracy, Virtual Reality and various technologies that have emerged or are being developed, influenced by Gibson’s literary visions.

results.title: My Beautiful laundrette [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Sarah Radclyffe, Tim Bevan, Channel Four, SAF Productions and Working Title Films
results.brief_description: Contemporary South London, with its mixture of races, classes and subcultures is the setting for this engaging film written by Hanif Kureishi. Omar is a young Anglo-Asian man on the make who is taken under the wing of his materialistic, and benevolently corrupt, Uncle Nasser. Omar is given a rundown laundromat to manage and he enlists an old school friend, Johnny, who has joined the National Front out of boredom, to help him run the business. Omar and Johnny begin a sexual relationship while around them friends and family try to get by as best they can in the divided society of Thatcherite Britain. One of the most joyous and insightful English films of the eighties. Cast includes Daniel Day Lewis, Saeed Jaffrey and Roshan Seth.
